anchor_text: NumberOfKnownLowVulnerabilities: The number of detected known vulnerabilities with low rating in the asset
target_text: The CSP shall document, communicated and implement in accordance to ISP-02 policies and procedures with technical and organisational measures to ensure the timely identification and addressing of vulnerabilities in the system components used to provide the cloud service

anchor_text: NumberOfKnownLowVulnerabilities: The number of detected known vulnerabilities with low rating in the asset
target_text: The policies and procedures shall describe measures regarding at least the following aspects:  Regular identification of vulnerabilities;  Assessment of the severity of identified vulnerabilities;  Prioritisation and implementation of actions to promptly remediate or mitigate identified vulnerabilities based on severity and according to defined timelines; and  Handling of system components for which no measures are initiated for the timely remediation or mitigation of vulnerabilities.

anchor_text: NumberOfKnownLowVulnerabilities: The number of detected known vulnerabilities with low rating in the asset
target_text: The CSP shall use a scoring system for the assessment of vulnerabilities that includes at least “critical” and “high” classes of vulnerabilities

anchor_text: NumberOfKnownLowVulnerabilities: The number of detected known vulnerabilities with low rating in the asset
target_text: The CSP shall mandate in its policies and procedures the immediate handling of “critical” vulnerabilities and the handling of “high” vulnerabilities within a day, with a follow-up of the vulnerability until it has been remediated

anchor_text: NumberOfKnownLowVulnerabilities: The number of detected known vulnerabilities with low rating in the asset
target_text: The CSP shall perform on a regular basis tests to detect publicly known vulnerabilities on the system components used to provide the cloud service, in accordance with policies for handling vulnerabilities (cf. OPS-17)

anchor_text: NumberOfKnownLowVulnerabilities: The number of detected known vulnerabilities with low rating in the asset
target_text: The CSP shall perform the tests defined in OPS-18.1 at least once a month

anchor_text: NumberOfKnownLowVulnerabilities: The number of detected known vulnerabilities with low rating in the asset
target_text: The CSP shall have penetration tests carried out by qualified internal personnel or external service providers, according to a documented test methodology and including in their scope the system components relevant to the provision of the cloud service in the area of responsibility of the CSP, as identified in a risk analysis

anchor_text: NumberOfKnownLowVulnerabilities: The number of detected known vulnerabilities with low rating in the asset
target_text: The CSP shall assess the penetration test findings and handle each identified vulnerability according to defined policies and procedures (cf. OPS-18).

anchor_text: NumberOfKnownLowVulnerabilities: The number of detected known vulnerabilities with low rating in the asset
target_text: The tests are performed following a multi-annual work program, reviewed annually, that covers system components and security controls according to the evolution of the cloud service and of the threat landscape.

anchor_text: NumberOfKnownLowVulnerabilities: The number of detected known vulnerabilities with low rating in the asset
target_text: Some of the penetration tests performed each year shall be performed by external service providers

anchor_text: NumberOfKnownLowVulnerabilities: The number of detected known vulnerabilities with low rating in the asset
target_text: The CSP shall perform a root cause analysis on the vulnerabilities discovered through penetration testing in order to assess to which extent similar vulnerabilities may be present in the cloud system

anchor_text: NumberOfKnownLowVulnerabilities: The number of detected known vulnerabilities with low rating in the asset
target_text: The CSP shall correlate the possible exploits of discovered vulnerabilities with previous incidents to identify if the vulnerability may have been exploited before its discovery

anchor_text: NumberOfKnownLowVulnerabilities: The number of detected known vulnerabilities with low rating in the asset
target_text: The CSP shall apply appropriate measures to check the cloud service for vulnerabilities that may have been integrated into the cloud service during the development process.

anchor_text: NumberOfKnownLowVulnerabilities: The number of detected known vulnerabilities with low rating in the asset
target_text: The procedures for identifying vulnerabilities shall be integrated in the development process.

anchor_text: NumberOfKnownLowVulnerabilities: The number of detected known vulnerabilities with low rating in the asset
target_text: The procedures shall include the following activities, depending on the risk assessment:  Static Application Security Testing;  Dynamic Application Security Testing;  Code reviews by subject matter experts; and  Obtaining information about confirmed vulnerabilities in software libraries provided by third parties and used in their own cloud service.

anchor_text: NumberOfKnownLowVulnerabilities: The number of detected known vulnerabilities with low rating in the asset
target_text: Code reviews shall be regularly performed by qualified personnel or contractors

anchor_text: NumberOfKnownLowVulnerabilities: The number of detected known vulnerabilities with low rating in the asset
target_text: The CSP shall assess the severity of identified vulnerabilities according to the criteria defined in OPS-17 and measures are taken to immediately eliminate or mitigate them.

anchor_text: NumberOfKnownLowVulnerabilities: The number of detected known vulnerabilities with low rating in the asset
target_text: The procedures for identifying such vulnerabilities also shall include annual code reviews and security penetration tests by subject matter experts, as part of the annual programme defined in OPS-19

anchor_text: IdentityPasswordPolicyEnabled: Checks whether the standard password policy has been disabled for a user
target_text: The CSP shall document and implement a policy and procedures about authentication mechanisms, covering at least the following aspects:  The selection of mechanisms suitable for every type of account and each level of risk;  The protection of credentials used by the authentication mechanism;  The generation and distribution of credentials for new accounts;  Rules for the renewal of credentials, including periodic renewals, renewals in case of loss or compromise; and  Rules on the required strength of credentials, together with mechanisms to communicate and enforce the rules;

anchor_text: IdentityPasswordPolicyEnabled: Checks whether the standard password policy has been disabled for a user
target_text: The access to all environments of the CSP shall be authenticated, including non-production environments

anchor_text: IdentityPasswordPolicyEnabled: Checks whether the standard password policy has been disabled for a user
target_text: The access to the production environment of the CSP shall require strong authentication

anchor_text: IdentityPasswordPolicyEnabled: Checks whether the standard password policy has been disabled for a user
target_text: The access to all environments of the CSP containing CSC data shall require strong authentication

anchor_text: IdentityPasswordPolicyEnabled: Checks whether the standard password policy has been disabled for a user
target_text: Within an environment, user authentication shall be performed through passwords, digitally signed certificates or procedures that achieve at least an equivalent level of security

anchor_text: IdentityPasswordPolicyEnabled: Checks whether the standard password policy has been disabled for a user
target_text: For access to non-personal shared accounts, the CSP shall implement measures that require the users to be authenticated with their personal account before being able to access these technical accounts

anchor_text: IdentityPasswordPolicyEnabled: Checks whether the standard password policy has been disabled for a user
target_text: All authentication mechanisms shall include a mechanism to block an account after a predefined number of unsuccessful attempts

anchor_text: IdentityPasswordPolicyEnabled: Checks whether the standard password policy has been disabled for a user
target_text: The CSP shall offer strong authentication methods to the CSC for use with the accounts under their responsibility

anchor_text: IdentityTimeSinceLastActivity: The last activity of an active user must be recent
target_text: The CSP shall define and implement an automated mechanism to block user accounts after a certain period of time

anchor_text: IdentityTimeSinceLastActivity: The last activity of an active user must be recent
target_text: The automated mechanism in IAM-03.1 shall block personal user accounts under the responsibility of the CSP after two (2) months of inactivity.

anchor_text: IdentityTimeSinceLastActivity: The last activity of an active user must be recent
target_text: The CSP shall define and implement an automated mechanism to block user accounts after a certain number of failed authentication attempts

anchor_text: IdentityTimeSinceLastActivity: The last activity of an active user must be recent
target_text: The limits on authentication attempts used in mechanism IAM-03.3 for user accounts under the responsibility of the CSP shall be based on the risks on the accounts, associated access rights and authentication mechanisms

anchor_text: IdentityTimeSinceLastActivity: The last activity of an active user must be recent
target_text: The CSP shall document a process to monitor stolen and compromised credentials and lock any pending account for which an issue is identified, pending a review by an authorized person

anchor_text: IdentityTimeSinceLastActivity: The last activity of an active user must be recent
target_text: The CSP shall implement the process in IAM-03.5 on all user accounts under its responsibility to which privileged access rights are assigned

anchor_text: IdentityTimeSinceLastActivity: The last activity of an active user must be recent
target_text: The CSP shall implement the process in IAM-03.5 on all user accounts under its responsibility

anchor_text: IdentityTimeSinceLastActivity: The last activity of an active user must be recent
target_text: Approval from authorised personnel or system components is required to unlock accounts locked automatically

anchor_text: IdentityTimeSinceLastActivity: The last activity of an active user must be recent
target_text: The CSP shall define and implement an automated mechanism to revoke user accounts that have been blocked by another automatic mechanism after a certain period of time

anchor_text: IdentityTimeSinceLastActivity: The last activity of an active user must be recent
target_text: The automated mechanism in IAM-03.9 shall revoke user accounts under the responsibility of the CSP after they have been blocked for six (6) months.

anchor_text: IdentityTimeSinceLastActivity: The last activity of an active user must be recent
target_text: The CSP shall automatically monitor the implemented automated mechanisms to guarantee their compliance with IAM-03

anchor_text: IdentityTimeSinceLastActivity: The last activity of an active user must be recent
target_text: The CSP shall automatically monitor the environmental conditions of authentication attempts and flag suspicious events to the corresponding user or to authorized persons

anchor_text: UserDisableMechanismAfterInactivity
target_text: The CSP shall define and implement an automated mechanism to block user accounts after a certain period of time

anchor_text: UserDisableMechanismAfterInactivity
target_text: The automated mechanism in IAM-03.1 shall block personal user accounts under the responsibility of the CSP after two (2) months of inactivity.

anchor_text: UserDisableMechanismAfterInactivity
target_text: The CSP shall define and implement an automated mechanism to block user accounts after a certain number of failed authentication attempts

anchor_text: UserDisableMechanismAfterInactivity
target_text: The limits on authentication attempts used in mechanism IAM-03.3 for user accounts under the responsibility of the CSP shall be based on the risks on the accounts, associated access rights and authentication mechanisms

anchor_text: UserDisableMechanismAfterInactivity

anchor_text: UserDisableMechanismAfterInactivity
target_text: The CSP shall implement the process in IAM-03.5 on all user accounts under its responsibility to which privileged access rights are assigned

target_text: The CSP shall implement the process in IAM-03.5 on all user accounts under its responsibility

target_text: Approval from authorised personnel or system components is required to unlock accounts locked automatically

target_text: The CSP shall define and implement an automated mechanism to revoke user accounts that have been blocked by another automatic mechanism after a certain period of time

anchor_text: UserDisableMechanismAfterInactivity
target_text: The automated mechanism in IAM-03.9 shall revoke user accounts under the responsibility of the CSP after they have been blocked for six (6) months.

anchor_text: UserDisableMechanismAfterInactivity
target_text: The CSP shall automatically monitor the implemented automated mechanisms to guarantee their compliance with IAM-03

anchor_text: UserDisableMechanismAfterInactivity
target_text: The CSP shall automatically monitor the environmental conditions of authentication attempts and flag suspicious events to the corresponding user or to authorized persons

anchor_text: PruneDisabledAccounts
target_text: The CSP shall define and implement an automated mechanism to block user accounts after a certain period of time

anchor_text: PruneDisabledAccounts
target_text: The automated mechanism in IAM-03.1 shall block personal user accounts under the responsibility of the CSP after two (2) months of inactivity.

anchor_text: PruneDisabledAccounts
target_text: The CSP shall define and implement an automated mechanism to block user accounts after a certain number of failed authentication attempts

anchor_text: PruneDisabledAccounts
target_text: The limits on authentication attempts used in mechanism IAM-03.3 for user accounts under the responsibility of the CSP shall be based on the risks on the accounts, associated access rights and authentication mechanisms

anchor_text: PruneDisabledAccounts
target_text: The CSP shall document a process to monitor stolen and compromised credentials and lock any pending account for which an issue is identified, pending a review by an authorized person

anchor_text: PruneDisabledAccounts
target_text: The CSP shall implement the process in IAM-03.5 on all user accounts under its responsibility to which privileged access rights are assigned

anchor_text: PruneDisabledAccounts
target_text: The CSP shall implement the process in IAM-03.5 on all user accounts under its responsibility

anchor_text: PruneDisabledAccounts
target_text: Approval from authorised personnel or system components is required to unlock accounts locked automatically

anchor_text: PruneDisabledAccounts
target_text: The CSP shall define and implement an automated mechanism to revoke user accounts that have been blocked by another automatic mechanism after a certain period of time

anchor_text: PruneDisabledAccounts
target_text: The automated mechanism in IAM-03.9 shall revoke user accounts under the responsibility of the CSP after they have been blocked for six (6) months.

anchor_text: PruneDisabledAccounts
target_text: The CSP shall automatically monitor the implemented automated mechanisms to guarantee their compliance with IAM-03

anchor_text: PruneDisabledAccounts
target_text: The CSP shall automatically monitor the environmental conditions of authentication attempts and flag suspicious events to the corresponding user or to authorized persons

anchor_text: PasswordPolicyComplianceEnforced: When creating a new password, it must be compliant with the password policy.
target_text: The CSP shall document, communicate and make available to all users under its responsibility rules and recommendations for the management of credentials, including at least:  Non-reuse of credentials  Trade-offs between entropy and ability to memorize  Recommendations for renewal of passwords  Rules on storage of passwords

anchor_text: PasswordPolicyComplianceEnforced: When creating a new password, it must be compliant with the password policy.
target_text: The CSP rules and recommendations defined in IAM-08.1 shall address at least the following aspects:  Recommendations on password managers  Recommendation to specifically address classical attacks, including phishing, social attacks, and whaling

anchor_text: PasswordPolicyComplianceEnforced: When creating a new password, it must be compliant with the password policy.
target_text: The CSP shall require users to whom authentication credentials are provided to sign a declaration in which they assure that they treat personal (or shared) authentication confidentially and keep it exclusively for themselves

anchor_text: PasswordPolicyComplianceEnforced: When creating a new password, it must be compliant with the password policy.
target_text: Passwords shall be only stored using cryptographically strong hash functions (cf. CKM-01)

anchor_text: PasswordPolicyComplianceEnforced: When creating a new password, it must be compliant with the password policy.
target_text: If cryptographic authentication mechanisms are used, they shall follow the policies and procedures from CKM-01.

anchor_text: PasswordPolicyComplianceEnforced: When creating a new password, it must be compliant with the password policy.
target_text: When creating credentials, compliance with specifications is enforced automatically as far as technically possible

anchor_text: PasswordPolicyComplianceEnforced: When creating a new password, it must be compliant with the password policy.
target_text: When a credential associated to a personal account is changed or renewed, the person associated to that account shall be notified

anchor_text: PasswordPolicyComplianceEnforced: When creating a new password, it must be compliant with the password policy.
target_text: Any password communicated to a user through e-mail, message or similar shall be changed by the user after its first use, and its validity shall not exceed 14 days after communication to the user

anchor_text: PasswordPolicyComplianceEnforced: When creating a new password, it must be compliant with the password policy.
target_text: The CSP shall make available to the CSC the rules and recommendations that shall or may apply to the users under their responsibility, and provide the CSC with tools to manage and enforce these rules

anchor_text: PasswordPolicyComplianceEnforced: When creating a new password, it must be compliant with the password policy.
target_text: The CSP shall document and implement a policy and procedures about authentication mechanisms, covering at least the following aspects:  The selection of mechanisms suitable for every type of account and each level of risk;  The protection of credentials used by the authentication mechanism;  The generation and distribution of credentials for new accounts;  Rules for the renewal of credentials, including periodic renewals, renewals in case of loss or compromise; and  Rules on the required strength of credentials, together with mechanisms to communicate and enforce the rules;

anchor_text: PasswordPolicyComplianceEnforced: When creating a new password, it must be compliant with the password policy.
target_text: The access to all environments of the CSP shall be authenticated, including non-production environments

anchor_text: PasswordPolicyComplianceEnforced: When creating a new password, it must be compliant with the password policy.
target_text: The access to the production environment of the CSP shall require strong authentication

anchor_text: PasswordPolicyComplianceEnforced: When creating a new password, it must be compliant with the password policy.
target_text: The access to all environments of the CSP containing CSC data shall require strong authentication

anchor_text: PasswordPolicyComplianceEnforced: When creating a new password, it must be compliant with the password policy.
target_text: Within an environment, user authentication shall be performed through passwords, digitally signed certificates or procedures that achieve at least an equivalent level of security

anchor_text: PasswordPolicyComplianceEnforced: When creating a new password, it must be compliant with the password policy.
target_text: For access to non-personal shared accounts, the CSP shall implement measures that require the users to be authenticated with their personal account before being able to access these technical accounts

anchor_text: PasswordPolicyComplianceEnforced: When creating a new password, it must be compliant with the password policy.
target_text: All authentication mechanisms shall include a mechanism to block an account after a predefined number of unsuccessful attempts

anchor_text: PasswordPolicyComplianceEnforced: When creating a new password, it must be compliant with the password policy.
target_text: The CSP shall offer strong authentication methods to the CSC for use with the accounts under their responsibility

anchor_text: AnomalyDetectionEnabled
target_text: The CSP shall document, communicate and implement technical safeguards that are suitable to promptly detect and respond to network-based attacks and to ensure the protection of information and information processing systems, in accordance with ISP-02

anchor_text: AnomalyDetectionEnabled
target_text: The technical safeguards in CS-01.1 shall be based on the results of a risk analysis carried out according to RM-01.

anchor_text: AnomalyDetectionEnabled
target_text: The CSP shall feed into a SIEM (Security Information and Event Management) system, all data from the technical safeguards implemented so that automatic countermeasures regarding correlating events are initiated

anchor_text: AnomalyDetectionEnabled
target_text: The CSP shall implement technical safeguards to ensure that no unknown (physical or virtual) devices join its (physical or virtual) network

anchor_text: AnomalyDetectionEnabled
target_text: The CSP shall use different technologies on its technical safeguards to prevent that a single vulnerability leads to the simultaneous breach of several defence lines

anchor_text: SessionManagementMechanism
target_text: A suitable session management system shall be used that at least corresponds to the state- of-the-art and is protected against known attacks

anchor_text: SessionManagementMechanism
target_text: The session management system shall include mechanisms that invalidate a session after it has been detected as inactive.

anchor_text: SessionManagementMechanism
target_text: If inactivity is detected by time measurement, the time interval shall be configurable by the CSP or – if technically possible – by the CSC

anchor_text: SessionExpirationMechanism
target_text: A suitable session management system shall be used that at least corresponds to the state- of-the-art and is protected against known attacks

anchor_text: SessionExpirationMechanism
target_text: The session management system shall include mechanisms that invalidate a session after it has been detected as inactive.

anchor_text: SessionExpirationMechanism
target_text: If inactivity is detected by time measurement, the time interval shall be configurable by the CSP or – if technically possible – by the CSC

anchor_text: SessionTimeout
target_text: A suitable session management system shall be used that at least corresponds to the state- of-the-art and is protected against known attacks

anchor_text: SessionTimeout
target_text: The session management system shall include mechanisms that invalidate a session after it has been detected as inactive.

anchor_text: SessionTimeout
target_text: If inactivity is detected by time measurement, the time interval shall be configurable by the CSP or – if technically possible – by the CSC

anchor_text: TlsVersion: Checks that only secure TLS versions (e.g. TLS 1.2, TLS 1.3) are used.
target_text: The CSP shall define and implement strong encryption mechanisms for the transmission of cloud customer data over public networks

anchor_text: TlsVersion: Checks that only secure TLS versions (e.g. TLS 1.2, TLS 1.3) are used.
target_text: The CSP shall define, and implement strong encryption mechanisms for the transmission of all data over public networks December 2020
